Σύνταξη: 
ΜΠΟΡΝΟΒΑΣ, Ι. & Θ. ΡΟΝΤΟΓΙΑΝΝΗ-ΤΣΙΑΜΠΑΟΥ, 1983. Γεωλογικός Χάρτης της Ελλάδας (1: 500.000), Ινστιτούτο Γεωλογικών και Μεταλλευτικών Ερευνών, Τομέας Γεωλογικών και Κοιτασματολογικών Ερευνών. Αθήνα

Σ. ΔΑΣΑΚΛΗΣ-Γ. ΣΙΓΑΛΟΣ ΟΕ 
Μαυροκορδάτου 6, Αθήνα, 10678 
Τηλ.: 2107703030/6944671158 
Email: dasaklis@gmail.com
attributes.description: Διανυσματοποίηση του Γεωλογικού της Ελλάδας, κλίμακας 1:500.000 (ΙΓΜΕ 1983), προκειμένου να υλοποιηθούν οι ενέργειες στο πλαίσιο της Εκτίμησης της Επιδεκτικότητας Έναντι Κατολισθήσεων του Ελλαδικού Χώρου που ερευνά η ΕΑΓΜΕ στα πλαίσια του Υποέργου 2 – ΓΕΩΚΑ του Έργου ΟΠΥΓΕΚ.Δημιουρία πολυγωνικού θεματικού επιπέδου σε μορφοποίησηESRI Personal Geodatabase Polygon Feature Class.

attributes.name: Fault

attributes.description: In the context of the Action of the ESPA project "Study and Research for Supporting the Energy Sector of the Industry and Entrepreneurship" (OPYGEK) and its subproject "Actions for the Exploitation of Primary and Secondary Mineral Resources" (DYOPI), it was deemed necessary to proceed with the implementation of the works for the creation of a digital file of drillings. For the implementation of this specific action, it was decided to develop an integrated geospatial database management system for drilling data. The creation of a geodatabase for all existing boreholes of metallic mineral resources was a fundamental priority and necessity for the rescue and dissemination of existing borehole data. First, an evaluation of the raw drilling data was performed from the availability of analog and digital drilling files for digitization. The registration of the data was done following international standards (INSPIRE directive) thus supporting the homogenization, usability and reusability of the data.
attributes.name: Ερευνητικές Γεωτρήσεις

For the implementation of this specific action, it was decided to develop an integrated geospatial database management system for drilling data. The creation of a geodatabase for all existing boreholes of metallic mineral resources was a fundamental priority and necessity for the rescue and dissemination of existing borehole data. First, an evaluation of the raw drilling data was performed from the availability of analog and digital drilling files for digitization. The registration of the data was done following international standards (INSPIRE directive) thus supporting the homogenization, usability and reusability of the data.
